org.eclipse.dataset

Interface IErrorDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDataset, ILazyDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompoundDataset, Dataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCompoundDataset, AbstractDataset, BooleanDataset, BooleanDatasetBase, ByteDataset, ComplexDoubleDataset, ComplexFloatDataset, CompoundByteDataset, CompoundDoubleDataset, CompoundFloatDataset, CompoundIntegerDataset, CompoundLongDataset, CompoundShortDataset, DoubleDataset, FloatDataset, IntegerDataset, LongDataset, ObjectDataset, ObjectDatasetBase, RGBDataset, ShortDataset, StringDataset, StringDatasetBase

    public interface IErrorDataset
extends IDataset
    This interface will be used with the plotting system to mark a given set of data to plot as having error. It needs to be adapted to support non-symmetric error bounds. The plotting system will attempt to plot any data which is also IErrorDataset including error bars unless setErrorBarEnabled(false) is explicitly called. This is a detail of the plotting system not the analysis algorithms.

    • Method Detail

      • hasErrors

        boolean hasErrors()
        If error information is set, returns true. Faster to call than getError() which constructs a new dataset.
        Returns:
        true if there is error data.

      • getError

        IDataset getError()
        Description copied from interface: ILazyDataset
        Get the errors, if any. These will in a shape that can broadcast to the dataset
        Specified by:
        getError in interface ILazyDataset
        Returns:
        the error dataset, constructing one if necessary

        Returns:

      • getErrorArray

        double[] getErrorArray(int... pos)
        Get the error values for a single point in the dataset
        Parameters:
        pos - of the point to be referenced
        Returns:
        the values of the error at this point (can be null when no error defined)

      • setError

        void setError(java.io.Serializable error)
